item.title: By: Tiffany Meuret
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Meuret
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://lunastationquarterly.com/the-joy-of-writing/#comment-767">Eva Odland</a>.
I just saw this, but I am so glad it helped! I've gone more than a year myself between writing for the same reasons as you. It's tortuous, but you'll find your way back when the time is right. Solidarity, friend!

item.title: By: Eva Odland
item.dc:creator: Eva Odland
item.description:
Thanks for the encouragement. I am in the middle of a "hiatus"....going on two years. Oh, I am still working, proofing and re-writing the first half of a novel I started five years ago and compiling a collection of short stories but to me this is not writing, but editing and part of publishing. I always feel the door is just about to pop open though...but as usual I find some excuse: My computer isn't right, (my old ThinkPad died and I loved the keyboard) my desk is a mess; I have too much day job stress, no free time. Yet despite my efforts otherwise I know eventually the door will open and I will find myself lost in another story...
Your article helped remind me of that....thanks.
